summary: This dispatch discusses the AMSPELL exhibit tour of Latin America from February to June 1964. The tour aimed to showcase the dangers and weaknesses of Castro-Communism. While the exhibit achieved excellent results in Guayaquil and La Paz, it was only moderately successful overall, failing in Quito, Santiago, and Montevideo. The dispatch evaluates the tour's effectiveness, highlighting organizational difficulties and the team's inexperience. It includes details on publicity, attendance, and challenges faced in various cities.
title: TYPIC/ANSPELL/Operational AMSPELL Tour of Latin America
